result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard F Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any sentence defendant is currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession or alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count 1, no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Count 1, but consecutive to any sentence defendant is currently serving.

Same conditions as counts 1 & 4, no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 & 4, but consecutive to any sentence the defendant is currently serving.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard F Allen in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Richard F Allen in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:05 PM. Scholke - resolved - plead to #1, #4 and #6 all with repeater attached and as alleged, withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - consecutive to his current prison time but concurrent to ES with restitution ordered. Court does not believe that would be possible. Scholke - still in prison for another 1 year on then ES for 4 years. State - believes State can only ask for 2 years probation for stated reaosns. Allen agrees. Scholke - other counts to be DRI.  State - have complied with victim notification requirements and have a VIS. Court dismisses and reads in counts 2, #3, and #5. Allen pleads G to counts #1, #4 and #6 (all as repeaters). Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - victim has submitted a restitution request in the amount of $1074.98 with VW surcharge of $107.49 for a total of $1182.47 (joint and several with co-defendant(s)). Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Allen makes statement, remorseful. Victim is present in the courtroom but does not wish to make a statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1, #4 and #6 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other but consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, costs - paid thru probation, restitution of $1182.47 - paid thru probation - joint and several with any future co-defendant, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, submit DNA sample with surcharge, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard F Allen in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Richard F Allen in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:26 PM. Scholke - not resolved - has gone over Frye - set for JT. State - offer was plead to count #1 as alleged, #2 - plead as alleged, #4 - plead to as alleged, all other counts DRI, court costs on each count and both parties were free to argue on the sentence. Allen agrees. Court continues bond, sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard F Allen in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Richard F Allen in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:15 PM. State calls Ronney Smith. Smith sworn in at 2:16 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (2:21 PM). Cross exam by Scholke at 2:27 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (2:28 PM). Re-direct by State at 2:29 PM. Smith excused at 2:30 PM. State calls James Polar Jr.. Polar sworn in at 2:30 PM. Direct exam by State. Polar excused at 2:33 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Scholke has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard F Allen in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Richard F Allen in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:41 AM. Allen and Scholke have complaint, waives reading of it, would like PH within 10 days - defendant is also on a probation hold. Court continues bond, sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Richard F Allen in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:27 AM. State puts off record conversations on the record regarding being represented by SPD, seems to be confusion with representation of the defendant. Court asks defendant if he has contacted SPD. Allen responds, was told he had four different attorneys and issues with conflict of interest. Chad Lynch from SPD makes statement regarding appointment of counsel. Court sets matter for another AIA, continues bond. Lynch given complaint in Court to take back to SPD. Court suggests that Allen called SPD again.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Richard F Allen appears via video from FC jail, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:11 PM. Court questions defendant on where his attorney is. Allen informs court he has contacted SPD but has not heard anything from SPD and is on a probation hold, revocation hearing is 1/7/16.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Richard F Allen in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:41 PM. Allen received complaint today. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Allen understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own, has contacted SPD and believes he is qualified. Court sets for AIA. State - bond - asks Court to continue bond for stated reasons. Court continues bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim (Ronny)
